subject: Cybersecurity
title: I2P and Freenet: Alternatives to Tor
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: I2P and Freenet: Alternatives to Tor.

hook.text: Tor isn't the only anonymity network. I2P and Freenet offer different approaches to hiding online activity.

buildup.text: I2P uses 'garlic routing' â€“ bundling multiple encrypted messages together. Freenet stores content across.

discovery.text: I2P is optimized for internal services. Freenet is designed for censorship-resistant publishing. Each has a unique strength.

twist.text: While Tor gets the headlines, I2P hosts some of the most secretive criminal communities because less attention.

climax.text: The dark web is not one place â€” it's a collection of anonymity networks, each with different users and cultures.

punchline.text: Tor is famous. The quieter networks are sometimes more dangerous.

quiz.question: How does I2P differ from Tor?
options: I2P uses 'garlic routing' bundling multiple messages and is optimized for internal services
